intro: Oenone richardiana, commonly known as the Richard's milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean islands. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap. The plant features showy, white to pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in umbels. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a velvety texture. Oenone richardiana is adapted to grow in sunny, well-drained soils, often found in coastal areas.
